alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 10:03AM PST until January 14 at 3:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Eureka CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Mad River near Arcata affecting Humboldt County. For the Mad River...including Arcata...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TONIGHT... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mad River near Arcata. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Severe flooding along Mad River Beach Road and extensive flooding of farmlands and other roads in the area. Flooding of residential areas around Tyee City is likely. Any low lying areas near the river could be flooded. Residents in these areas should be prepared to take appropriate action to protect lives and property. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM PST Saturday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 25.1 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.9 feet on 02/08/1960. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM PST.
